column4: hi, when I put an usb drive and it automounts, is gnome who is doing that? or is it ubuntu?
gnome-volume-manager is supposed to be monitoring constantly, just plugging in a drive should trigger the mount event
it is not mounting the usb drive
check ps -aux , are dbus-daemon , hald , and gnome-volume-manger all running?
I don't see hald, which would cause that. Why it quit, I don't know. run ps aux | grep hald to be sure; you can try sudo /etc/init.d/hal restart
don't paste here, and hald isn't in that list, just the addons
you can see if there's a core file for hald in /var/crash , I don't know how to read it but others do
that worked then? And what's lapsus brutus ! :)
is like saying it was a moment I wasn't thinkig
latin for doh, I'm dumb! then
